channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8342] TestTableInputFormatScan#testScanFromConfiguration fails on hadoop2 profile
item.description:
When scan information is sent via configuration (instead of jobconf), the unit test fails with this in the yarn/mr2 MRAppMaster.


2013-04-13 03:42:57,168 FATAL [main] org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.v2.app.MRAppMaster: Error starting MRAppMaster

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/hadoop/hbase/mapreduce/TableMapper

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
this log message is found in the syslog file found in this working data dir:

./hbase-server/target/org.apache.hadoop.mapred.MiniMRCluster

find -name syslog | xargs less

This is failing at a class loading attempt for a ScanMapper (a static class defined in TableInputFormat derived from TableMapper) in the MRAppMaster process. TableMapper is an abstract class that lives in hbase-server main. This seems to mean that the test class is in the class path but the hbase-server main is not...
TableInputFormat is used as well – and also lives in hbase-server main. Time to dig into how the MRAppMaster picks what is in its class path when that process is kicked off.

This seems directly related to issues broguth up in YARN-449 – MRAppMaster not setting class path correctly – but I don't think they are because my testing is on hadoop 2.0.2-alpha .

Up at YARN-449, it says that the issue affects hadoop-2.0.4-alpha-SNAPSHOT due to YARN-429. It also mentions YARN-129 which landed in 2.0.3-alpha. Both of these don't seem relevant to the 2.0.2 world I'm still working on.

Dumping the Jobs that are submitted to the MR2 framework, in passing jobs we have the "tmpjars" value set (which is read by the JobSumitter#copyAndConifigureFiles method that copies jars required to jobs)


<property><name>tmpjars</name><value>file:/home/jon/proj/hbase/hbase-server/target/test-dir/hadoop-4641972520833942860.jar,file:/home/jon/proj/hbase/hbase-server/target/test-dir/hadoop-9043094595585370808.jar,file:/home/jon/proj/hbase/hbase-server/target/test-dir/hadoop-4595210641677463558.jar,file:/home/jon/.m2/repository/com/google/protobuf/protobuf-java/2.4.1/protobuf-java-2.4.1.jar,file:/home/jon/proj/hbase/hbase-server/target/test-dir/hadoop-8534779815631263049.jar,file:/home/jon/.m2/repository/org/apache/zookeeper/zookeeper/3.4.5/zookeeper-3.4.5.jar,file:/home/jon/proj/hbase/hbase-server/target/test-dir/hadoop-5815093030924489079.jar,file:/home/jon/proj/hbase/hbase-server/target/test-dir/hadoop-8922627291995251720.jar,file:/home/jon/.m2/repository/org/cloudera/htrace/htrace/1.50/htrace-1.50.jar,file:/home/jon/.m2/repository/com/google/guava/guava/12.0.1/guava-12.0.1.jar,file:/home/jon/.m2/repository/org/apache/hadoop/hadoop-mapreduce-client-core/2.0.2-alpha/hadoop-mapreduce-client-core-2.0.2-alpha.jar,file:/home/jon/proj/hbase/hbase-server/target/test-dir/hadoop-3503261906366143899.jar,file:/home/jon/.m2/repository/org/apache/hadoop/hadoop-common/2.0.2-alpha/hadoop-common-2.0.2-alpha.jar</value><source>programatically</source></property>

The hadoop-[0-9]*.jar files correspond to hbase jars.

In the failing case, the job does not set this value at and has significantly fewer configuration values included into the job's configraution.
Simple patch to fix broken unit test. Should be the last consistently broken trunk on hadoop2 test!

Since in yarn the MRAppMaster is in a separate jvm and process we need to specify the jars to copy into the job. Adding a call to TableMapReduceUtil.addDependencyJars provides info so the mr2 job can include the proper jars and fixes the problem.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12578753/hbase-8342.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.TestZooKeeper

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5314//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5314//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-protocol.html

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5314//console

This message is automatically generated.
The failure is unrelated. Committed to 0.95 and trunk/.98 Thanks for the review elliott.
I'm a little late to the party, but +1 after-the-fact
